Janwulf is civilized and well dressed as frost giants go. He keeps himself clean and groomed, and he has a great appreciation for civilized luxury of all kinds.

monster.name: Skyshadow

immune.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

languages: understands the languages of its master but can't speak

trait.name: Bound To Master
entries: Skyshadow follows the commands of its master. If Skyshadow's master is slain, the creature who delivered the killing blow can become the creature's new master or can designate a different master. While Skyshadow is on the same plane of existence as its master, it can magically convey what it senses to its master, and the two can communicate telepathically.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: Skyshadow and its rider don't provoke opportunity attacks when Skyshadow flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: Skyshadow is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Skyshadow has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Shadow Clutch
entries: When Skyshadow deals damage to a creature, the creature is shadow clutched for 1 minute. A shadow clutched creature must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw at the beginning of each of its turns. On a failed save, the creature takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage. If the target succeeds on three of these saves, the effect ends for it. The successes don't need to be consecutive; keep track of the successful saves until the creature collects three of them.

trait.name: Unholy Grace
entries: Skyshadow adds its Charisma modifier to its Armor Class and on saving throws (accounted for in its statistics).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Skyshadow makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

legendary.name: Move
entries: Skyshadow moves up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Assault
entries: Skyshadow makes one claw attack.

legendary.name: Shadow Flight
entries: Skyshadow teleports itself and its rider to a spot within 5 feet of a shadow clutched creature it can see.

{@creature Gorguth|EdE} rides Skyshadow, an enormous construct mount created by stripping the magical essence from a nightwing and binding it into the form of a construct. The creature carries Gorguth over immense battlefields, wreaking havoc upon the forces below.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Gorguth is a 7th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks). Gorguth has the following spells prepared:

trait.name: Aura of Annihilation
entries: Gorguth can activate or deactivate this feature as a bonus action. While active, any creature that ends its turn within 30 feet of Gorguth take 15 necrotic damage. Constructs, fiends, and undead ignore this effect.

trait.name: Death Gaze
entries: When a creature that isn't a construct, fiend, or undead that can see Gorguth's eyes starts its turn within 30 feet of Gorguth, it is forced to make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw if Gorguth isn't {@condition incapacitated} and can see the creature. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is reduced to 0 hit points, unless it is immune to the {@condition frightened} condition. Otherwise, a creature takes 16 ({@damage 3d10}) psychic damage on a failed save.

Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it has disadvantage on attack rolls against Gorguth until the start of its next turn. If the creature looks at Gorguth in the meantime, it must immediately make the saving throw.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Gorguth fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Steal Life
entries: When Gorguth reduces a creature to 0 hit points, it regains 15 hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Gorguth makes two attacks with its Unholy Longsword.

action.name: Unholy Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target.  {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) slashing damage, or 10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Withering Gaze
entries: One creature that Gorguth can see within 90 feet of it must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

reaction.name: Obliviation of Spirit
entries: When a creature within 60 feet of Gorguth dies, Gorguth can annihilate its soul. That creature can't be revived by any means short of a {@spell wish} spell.
The World Born Dead comes for the living. The time has come to make our strike. The time has come for the dead to rule.

Loosed from the turmoil of the Infinite Layers of the Abyss, Gorguth commands a massive army of undead and demons. To prepare the way for its master, it leads its hordes to slaughter the living in a grand orgy of violence. Gorguth despises its existence and hopes to find release in the annihilation of the world.

entries.name: Goals
entries: Sickened by Orcus' incessant plotting, Gorguth fled the Abyss for the Material Plane, where it gladly serves Atropus. Gorgoth follows this new entity not out of affection or loyalty but because it promises an end to the nightmare of existence. Gorguth spends its forces in appalling numbers, caring nothing for the cost; those they slay simply rise up to fill the depleted ranks.

entries.name: Using Gorguth
entries: Gorguth is destruction incarnate. It should distract the party from attending to the larger threat, maybe even causing them to attribute the weird sign to it instead of the true source. Gorguth can be a menacing enemy, a whispered villain, or a looming threat. Use Gorguth to propel the story forward or to represent the upheaval and chaos resulting from Atropus's approach.

entries.name: Description
entries: The Bleak General is terrifying. Beneath its black leather armor, fashioned from the cured faces of mortals it has slain, lies the wretched body of a {@creature bodak|VGM}—genderless, black, and with an empty visage. When its endless legions march, Gorguth rides on the back of {@creature Skyshadow|EdE} (its flying mount), surveying the movements of its forces and swooping down to embolden them and shore up flagging lines.

It's clear to anyone who survives a brush with its baleful gaze that something awful and alien drives this undead monster. Any trace of mercy or compassion was scourged from it ages ago by the endless torments of the demons and the countless engagements it has fought against many foes.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Caira is a 17th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 19}, {@hit 11} to hit with spell attacks). She can cast {@spell hold person} at its lowest level at will, without expending a spell slot, and she adds her Wisdom modifier to the damage she deals with any cantrip. Caira has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Anti-Heal
entries: Caira can activate or deactivate this feature as a bonus action. While active, creatures within 45 feet of Caira can't magically regain hit points. A creature that were to magically regain hit points must instead make a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes necrotic damage equal to the hit points it would have regained.

trait.name: Dark Knowledge
entries: After Caira makes an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, but before the outcome is determined, an additional {@dice d20} can be rolled. Caira chooses which of the d20s rolled is used to determine the outcome. When she does so, she takes 12 ({@damage 5d4}) necrotic damage, which can't be reduced or prevented in any way.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If Caira is subjected to an effect that allows her to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, she instead takes no damage if she succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if she fails.

trait.name: Godhate
entries: Caira has advantage on saving throws against divine spells, which are spells cast by clerics, paladins, druids, rangers, celestials, and other sources the DM deems appropriate.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Caira fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: Caira deals an extra 14 ({@dice 4d6}) damage when she hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of Caira that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and Caira doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Caira makes two attacks with her frost rapier.

action.name: Frost Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) cold damage.

action.name: Gaze of Corruption {@recharge}
entries: Caira targets one creature she can see within 30 feet of her. The target must succeed on a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw or take 16 ({@damage 3d10}) necrotic damage and be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. The {@condition poisoned} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Dark Speech
entries: Caira takes 13 ({@damage 2d12}) psychic damage, and each creature within 60 feet of Caira that can hear her must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} (Caira's choice) for 1 minute. A {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

reaction.name: Steal Magic
entries: In response to being targeted by a spell or being included in a spell's area of effect, Caira can prepare the spell for herself, treating it as a cleric spell until she completes a long rest. Caira can only prepared one spell in this fashion at a time. If she uses this feature again on a different spell, the old spell is immediately unprepared.
I hate the gods. They took my love, my life, everything I am. I will punish them by taking from them what they most love: life. All your little lives that are so precious to them.

Caira Xasten is a cruel ur-priest, a foul thief of divine energy who bends it to her will. Driven by an insane desire for revenge and emptied of compassion and mercy by the tragedies of her life, she seeks to lift the burden of her grief.

entries.name: Goals
entries: Caira Xasten wants to destroy the world. She doesn't want power—she wants revenge. Years ago, her lover and colleague was struck down by a falling meteorite. The chances of such an accident were so slim that she blamed the gods. Robbed of a life with the one person she loved more than anything, she went insane and bent all her considerable resources to visiting ruin on those entities she despised. She cares nothing for her own life or for the deaths of those who stand in her way.

entries.name: Using Caira Xasten
entries: Caira Xasten is a powerful adversary and one with unreasonable goals. For much of the campaign, she can be a faceless villain, a distant threat protected by layers of minions. The encounters the party has with her as the campaign unfolds should be through minions, such as when the minions steal the forbidden tome beneath the cathedral, attempt to harvest angel tears, or scour the land for the {@item book of vile darkness}. When she begins to cast {@spell apocalypse from the sky|EdE}, the party should finally uncover her identity and confront her in the depths of her hidden lair.

entries.name: Description
entries: Time has not been kind to Caira. Whip-thin, tall, and fierce, she has a face that reveals the madness and corruption that has haunted her since she vowed service to Atropus. Her once-lustrous long, black hair now hangs loose and wild where it's not caught in tangles. Deep crow's feet stretch out from the sides of her red-rimmed eyes, and her mouth is frozen in a grimace. Caira wears tight-fitting gray breeches and a pale yellow shirt, both of which are pierced with small holes and covered with old stains from her experiments.

monster.name: Advanced Aspect of the Leviathan
languages: understands all languages but can't speak

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The aspect can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Anathematic Secrecy
entries: The aspect can't be targeted by any divination magic or perceived through magical scrying sensors.

trait.name: Freedom of Movement
entries: The aspect ignores difficult terrain, and magical effects can't reduce its speed or cause it to be {@condition restrained}. It can spend 5 feet of movement to escape from nonmagical restraints or being {@condition grappled}.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the aspect fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The aspect has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The aspect's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The aspect deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Unyielding Essence
entries: The aspect is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form, as well as those that would read its thoughts, determine if it is lying, or magically influence its thoughts or behavior.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The aspect can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite, one with its claw, and one with its tail. It can use its Swallow instead of its bite.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}36 ({@damage 4d12 + 10}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 20}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the aspect can't bite another target.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 4d8 + 10}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 4d6 + 10}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 25} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the aspect's choice within 120 feet of it and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the aspect is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the aspect's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Swallow
entries: The aspect makes one bite attack against a Large or smaller creature it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target takes the bite's damage, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the aspect, and it takes 42 ({@damage 12d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the aspect's turns.

If the aspect takes 50 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the aspect must succeed on a {@dc 25} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the aspect. If the aspect dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 30 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The aspect moves up to its speed.

legendary.name: Tail Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The aspect makes one tail attack.

legendary.name: Chaotic Surge (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Each creature within 120 feet of the aspect must succeed on a {@dc 20} Charisma saving throw or suffer a random chaotic effect, determined by rolling on the {@table Chaotic Surge table|EdE}.
The Leviathan is an impossibly large sea serpent, somewhat reptilian and primitive in appearance. Its vast head alone is the size of a small kingdom.

So enormous is the Leviathan that in many places its body has become part of the landscape. Seamounts and fissures, islands and dormant volcanoes—covered in vegetation and indistinguishable from surrounding terrain—all make up part of the great beast.

A complex interplay of thoughts and emotions fuels the Leviathan's wild dreams, its restless stirring, and its destructive thrashing and rampaging. Its chaotic mind and soul yearn only to unmake that which the gods made and, in doing so, to unmake itself.

The Leviathan itself is so huge that normal statistics are meaningless, and it is impossible for anything short of a god's avatar to effectively fight it directly. The most that mortals can hope to do is send it back to sleep if it awakens.

Creatures created by the Leviathan's dreams manifest on both land and at sea and take the form of aberrations or aquatic creatures such as megalodons and sea serpents. The most deadly of the Leviathan's manifestations are miniature versions of itself. These aspects of the Leviathan become more common as the beast approaches wakefulness.

monster.name: Aspect of the Leviathan
languages: understands all languages but can't speak

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The aspect can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Anathematic Secrecy
entries: The aspect can't be targeted by any divination magic or perceived through magical scrying sensors.

trait.name: Freedom of Movement
entries: The aspect ignores difficult terrain, and magical effects can't reduce its speed or cause it to be {@condition restrained}. It can spend 5 feet of movement to escape from nonmagical restraints or being {@condition grappled}.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the aspect fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The aspect has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The aspect's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The aspect deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Unyielding Essence
entries: The aspect is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form, as well as those that would read its thoughts, determine if it is lying, or magically influence its thoughts or behavior.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The aspect makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claw.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the aspect can't bite another target.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature and is Huge or smaller, it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The aspect moves up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Tail Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The aspect makes one tail attack.

legendary.name: Chaotic Surge (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Each creature within 60 feet of the aspect must succeed on a {@dc 17} Charisma saving throw or suffer a random chaotic effect, determined by rolling on the {@table Chaotic Surge table|EdE}.
The Leviathan is an impossibly large sea serpent, somewhat reptilian and primitive in appearance. Its vast head alone is the size of a small kingdom.

So enormous is the Leviathan that in many places its body has become part of the landscape. Seamounts and fissures, islands and dormant volcanoes—covered in vegetation and indistinguishable from surrounding terrain—all make up part of the great beast.

A complex interplay of thoughts and emotions fuels the Leviathan's wild dreams, its restless stirring, and its destructive thrashing and rampaging. Its chaotic mind and soul yearn only to unmake that which the gods made and, in doing so, to unmake itself.

The Leviathan itself is so huge that normal statistics are meaningless, and it is impossible for anything short of a god's avatar to effectively fight it directly. The most that mortals can hope to do is send it back to sleep if it awakens.

Creatures created by the Leviathan's dreams manifest on both land and at sea and take the form of aberrations or aquatic creatures such as megalodons and sea serpents. The most deadly of the Leviathan's manifestations are miniature versions of itself. These aspects of the Leviathan become more common as the beast approaches wakefulness.

trait.name: Assassinate
entries: During his first turn, Marcus has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit Marcus scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

trait.name: Cunning Action
entries: On each of his turns, Marcus can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If Marcus is subjected to an effect that allows him to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, he instead takes no damage if he succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: Marcus deals an extra 14 ({@dice 4d6}) damage when he hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of Marcus that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and Marcus doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll. He also deals this extra damage when Marcus is within 5 feet of the target, no other creatures are within 5 feet of him, and he doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Suave Defense
entries: While Marcus is wearing light or no armor and wielding no shield, his AC includes his Charisma modifier (accounted for in his statistics).

trait.name: Two Minds of Madness
entries: Marcus has advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Marcus makes four attacks with his rapier. Marcus can increase the reach of two of these attacks by 5 feet.

action.name: +1 Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) piercing damage. A creature targeted by this attack can't make opportunity attacks against Marcus for the rest of his turn, even if the attack misses.

reaction.name: Insane Defiance
entries: In response to being targeted by an effect that would magically influence his mind, Marcus can retarget the effect to another creature of his choice, other than the caster or source of the ability, within the effect's range.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: Marcus halves the damage that he takes from an attack that hits him. Marcus must be able to see the attacker.
How may I serve the Prince of Demons?

{@creature Axihuatl|EdE}'s plan to drown the world suits Demogorgon just fine, since it aids his ixitxachitl worshipers as well as his demonic ally Dagon. The ixitxachitl's plans require the assistance of surface dwellers, and Demogorgon has commanded his minion Marcus Hape to assist Axihuatl in any way possible.

entries.name: Goals
entries: Marcus lives only to serve Demogorgon. He has placed himself in thrall to the Prince of Demons and hopes that his master will eventually reward him for his faithful service. He views the opportunity to aid Axihuatl with enthusiasm; Marcus believes that by playing a role in the destruction of civilization, he will show himself to be Demogorgon's most valuable minion. He secretly hopes that his prince will preserve a small amount of land after the deluge so that he can continue to serve Demogorgon as the absolute ruler of the surviving surface-dwellers.

entries.name: Using Marcus
entries: Marcus knows "Enshaddon's" true identity and obeys him without question. He leads a group of assassins and rogues directed to destroy the party and tries to sabotage their plans whenever possible. If desperate, Marcus attacks the party directly. If he survives these encounters, he will be with Axihuatl's cultists during the confrontation inside the Spine Temple.

entries.name: Description
entries: Once a handsome, aspiring actor, Marcus Hape fell in with a bad crowd of decadents and "sophisticates" who claimed to worship the forces of darkness. His friends were nothing more than poseurs, but Marcus eventually fell into the clutches of the true cult of Demogorgon and took up life as an assassin.

Today, Marcus does his master's bidding in the hope that he will one day receive his "rightful" reward from the forces of darkness. He retains some of his actor's good looks, with wavy black hair and a small, neat beard, but the left side of his face is badly scarred, leaving his eye a dead, milky white—the self-inflicted symbol of his devotion to Demogorgon.

monster.name: Axihuatl

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Axihuatl is a 16th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 20}, {@hit 12} to hit with spell attacks). Axihuatl has the following cleric spells prepared:
footerEntries: *Axihuatl casts this spell before combat to summon a {@creature wastrilith|mtf}. This wastrilith aids Axihuatl in combat in exchange for Axihuatl's service as a cleric of {@cult Demonic Boon of Demogorgon|MTF|Demogorgon}.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Axihuatl wears an {@item ioun stone, insight|dmg|ioun stone of insight} (accounted for in his statistics) and an {@item abyssal shard|EdE}. While the {@i abyssal shard} orbits his head, Axihuatl has advantage on all saving throws.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: Axihuatl can use his action to polymorph into a form that resembles a Medium humanoid, or back into his true ixitxachitl form. Aside from his size and the walking speed of his new form, his statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment he is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.

trait.name: Conduit of Chaos
entries: When Axihuatl casts a spell that deals damage, he can change the spell's damage type to cold, fire, force, lightning, necrotic, or thunder.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Axithuatl fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Two Minds of Madness
entries: Axihuatl has advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws.

action.name: Vampiric Bite (True Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d8 + 2}) piercing damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken, and Axihuatl regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

reaction.name: Barbed Tail (True Form Only)
entries: When a creature provokes an opportunity attack from Axihuatl, he can make the following attack instead of using his bite.
{@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) piercing damage.

legendaryHeader: Axihuatl can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Axihuatl regains spent legendary actions at the start of his turn.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: Axithuatl makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Teleport (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Axithuatl magically teleports, along with any equipment he is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space he can see.

legendary.name: Tsunami (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Axithuatl casts {@spell tsunami} using an 8th level spell slot.

Long have the air-breathers plagued my people. Long have they interfered with our destiny. Their dominion over this world shall soon end, drowned beneath the mighty waters. The Leviathan shall rise, my people, and we shall be its masters!

The vampiric ixitxachitl called Axihuatl is nearly three centuries old and has grown to enormous size and power. A faithful priest of {@cult Demonic Boon of Demogorgon|MTF|Demogorgon}, Axihuatl is an exemplary member of his species, which is to say he is cruel, hateful, violent, and nothing less than fanatical in his desire to rid the world of the hated surface-dwellers.

entries.name: Goals
entries: The ixitxachitls always knew that the Leviathan exists—in the depths of the seas, it's hard to miss such a vast creature—but they remained ignorant of the beast's true nature and power. During his years spent studying ancient and near-forgotten lore, Axihuatl discovered how to harness the Leviathan's chaotic energy for his people's use.

It is his intention to use rituals to rouse the Leviathan—but not to wake it completely, since that would end the world as well as Axihuatl and his people. In a state of semiwakefulness, however, the Leviathan is susceptible to at least partial control, and its enormous destructive powers can be channeled against specific targets. Axihuatl intends to turn it against the surface-dwellers and their hated continents, leaving the world under miles of water where the ixitxachitl can rule unopposed. Axihuatl finds it deliciously ironic that, in the guise of the human cult-leader Enshaddon, he uses the surface-dwellers to perform those portions of the ritual that must be carried out on land.

entries.name: Using Axihuatl
entries: Axihuatl does not make his presence known immediately. For much of the time, the party sees him as Enshaddon and believe that he is nothing more than a demented human priest. When the party disrupts Axihuatl's plans, he takes a personal interest in them and unleashes his various minions against the party.

Until Axihuatl is actually revealed as an ixitxachitl, he operates in the background, primarily through other creatures in his thrall. After the party disrupts his first ceremony, Axihuatl sees them as a threat and directs {@creature Marcus Hape|EdE} to deal with them.

Once his ritual goes wrong and the Leviathan threatens the world, Axihuatl reluctantly approaches the party, asking for aid. He instructs the party on how to use the {@item abyssal shard|EdE} to send the Leviathan back to sleep and might even be willing to accompany the party. If he does accompany the party, Axihuatl will not actively help them, but he defends himself if attacked. For the most part, he hangs back and does as little as possible—either because he is planning to destroy the party once he has completed his task, or due to his well-developed sense of self-preservation.

entries.name: Description
entries: Axihuatl is a vampiric ixitxachitl who has been alive for 290 years. In this time he has grown to considerable size and now resembles a mottled, horrific manta ray with large, intelligent eyes, a thick tail, and well-developed fins capable of dexterously manipulating objects.

In his researches and travels, Axihuatl has located an {@item ioun stone, insight|dmg|ioun stone of insight}, which he found while searching for one of his most important possessions—a legendary {@item abyssal shard}. The Shard is a fragment of black rock that orbits Axihuatl's head in a fashion similar to an ioun stone. This object is critical to his plans to awaken the Leviathan and will also play an important role in putting it back to sleep once the task of destroying the surface world is complete.

Recently, Axihuatl has been spending considerable time in the surface world, using his Shapechanger trait to magically transform himself into his human alter ego: Enshaddon, high priest of the Leviathan. In this form, he leads the Cult of the Leviathan and has been using human worshipers to perform rituals to summon aberrations and awaken the Leviathan.

trait.name: Cunning Action
entries: On each of its turns, the assassin can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the assassin is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the assassin instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Freeze
entries: If the assassin takes cold damage, it partially freezes; its speed is reduced by 20 feet until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The assassin deals an extra 14 ({@dice 4d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the assassin that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the assassin doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Water Form
entries: The assassin can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. Furthermore, the assassin is {@condition invisible} while fully immersed in water.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The assassin makes three melee attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Water Jet {@recharge 5}
entries: The assassin unleashes a jet of water in a line that is 60 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in the line must make a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Whelm {@recharge 4}
entries: Each creature in the assassin's space must make a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. If it is Large or smaller, it is also {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and unable to breathe unless it can breathe water. If the saving throw is successful, the target is pushed out of the assassin's space.

The assassin can grapple one Large creature or up to two Medium or smaller creatures at one time. At the start of each of the assassin's turns, each target {@condition grappled} by it takes 14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. A creature within 5 feet of the assassin can pull a creature or object out of it by taking an action to make a {@dc 15} Strength and succeeding.

The walls around you groan, buckle, and bulge outward as a torrent of water sprays out from a dozen rents. The water flows together, forming a monstrous shape. Bits of rock, dirt, and bones float within it, along with the shredded remnants of weapons, armor, and clothing. The shape rushes toward you like a tidal wave as it attacks.

A waterveiled assassin is a creature of living water sent by Olhydra, Prince of Evil Water Elementals, to slay her cult's enemies. This deadly killer can flow through the smallest cracks to ambush and engulf foes, and its fluid form lets it strike at opponents from a great distance.

entries.name: Strategies and Tactics
entries: Waterveiled assassins are cunning hunters that take full advantage of terrain and their special abilities to surprise foes. An assassin prefers to lurk within a wall, a large statue, or another similar object that can contain its bulk. From there, it watches its targets, attacking when they least expect it. The creature is clever enough to focus on spellcasters and other opponents with dangerous abilities. Its liquid form makes it difficult to injure, so it ignores physical attacks. This confidence sometimes leads to rashness: An assassin might leap on a party's wizard, disregarding melee combatants until they have dealt it serious damage.

A waterveiled assassin travels through a river or stream to infiltrate a city or enemy camp. Once there, it relies on information from the temple's spies and scouts, or clerics' divination magic, to find its target. The assassin attempts to engulf and drag off the victim to an isolated spot for the kill. It usually lets weaker creatures drown within its liquid body. Stronger targets require coordinated attacks; for example, the assassin might drag a foe to a nearby river and a waiting team of {@creature sahuagin}.

entries.name: Ecology
entries: A waterveiled assassin is the highest gift that Olhydra can bestow upon priests of the Elder Elemental Eye. Within water temples, assassins occupy hallowed positions as embodiments of Olhydra's will. In addition to being a weapon against powerful foes, an assassin offers advice and counsel to the clerics and might even lead the temple. Underlings, usually sahuagin rogues or rangers, help it track down the temple's enemies.

entries.name: Environment
entries: Waterveiled assassins are native to the Elemental Plane of Water but are usually found in aquatic locales, typically in a water temple of the Elder Elemental Eye or a water node. Any body of water might contain an assassin that is on a mission.

entries.name: Typical Physical Characteristics
entries: A waterveiled assassin stands 16 feet tall and weighs around 3,000 pounds. It looks like a towering wave of murky water.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: As the creation of Olhydra, a waterveiled assassin is always neutral evil.

entries.name: Waterveiled Assassin Lore
entries: Characters with proficiency in the {@skill Arcana} skill can learn more about a waterveiled assassin. When a character makes a check using their Arcana skill, the following lore is revealed, including the information from lower DCs.

entries.caption: Waterveiled Assassin Lore
rows: This creature composed of liquid is obviously an elemental, sharing many of its traits with a normal {@creature water elemental}.
This creature is a waterveiled assassin, an avatar of Olhydra, Prince of Evil Water Elementals. Its watery body simply ignores many physical attacks and spells.
A waterveiled assassin's most fearsome attack is its ability to engulf opponents within its liquid form and grind them in its currents.
A waterveiled assassin can flow through tiny cracks in seemingly solid material. It can seep into the earth, move through holes in a wall, and hide within porous objects.

trait.name: Dark Devotion
entries: The cultist has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The cultist can hold its breath for 15 minutes.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cultist makes three attacks with its trident or dagger.

action.name: Trident
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage, or 6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

Brine cultists are evil servants of water-centric cults and organizations. For example, some can be found in the service of extraplanar entities such as Olhydra, the Princess of Evil Water, or Dagon, the Prince of the Depths. They can also be found worshiping powerful aquatic creatures such as a {@creature kraken} or the {@cult The Leviathan|EdE|Leviathan}.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Mytus is a 9th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). Mytus has the following wizard spells prepared:

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The chaos spawn's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:
footerEntries: *When cast underwater, this spell creates a raging area of turbulent water. This turbulence takes the form of a 30-foot-radius sphere that pulls restrained creatures towards the center of the sphere, rather than towards the top of the original spell's cylinder.

trait.name: Conduit of Chaos
entries: When the chaos spawn deals damage, it can change the damage type to cold, fire, force, lightning, necrotic, or thunder.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The chaos spawn is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The chaos spawn can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The chaos spawn has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The chaos spawn makes two attacks.

action.name: Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) force damage.

action.name: Chaos Orb
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 7} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d12 + 3}) force damage.

action.name: Chaotic Surge {@recharge 5}
entries: Each creature within 60 feet of the chaos spawn must succeed on a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw or suffer a random chaotic effect, determined by rolling on the {@table Chaotic Surge table|EdE}.

Chaos spawn are birthed by the chaotic churnings of The Leviathan's dreams. A strange hybrid between an aberration and an elemental, chaos spawn are weightless spheres of pulsating energy that emit random forms of elemental energy. When alone, they spread destruction and disorder wherever they go. However, when given telepathic orders by another manifestation of The Leviathan's dreams, or when they are near the heart of The Leviathan itself, they serve the elder evil's unconscious will to the best of their ability.

trait.name: Aerial Artistry
entries: The acrobat doesn't take damage from falling. Additionally, when the acrobat moves, it can instead take multiple short movements by flying. Each movement can be up to 15 feet, and it must end each one on a solid object or the ground. If it does not, it falls and its movement ends.

trait.name: Cunning Action
entries: On each of its turns, the acrobat can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the acrobat is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the acrobat instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The acrobat deals an extra 17 ({@dice 5d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the acrobat that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the acrobat doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Two Minds of Madness
entries: The acrobat has advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: The acrobat halves the damage that it takes from an attack that hits it. The acrobat must be able to see the attacker.

Fiendish acrobats are evil rogues that have gone mad due to the influence of {@cult Demonic Boon of Demogorgon|MTF|Demogorgon}. They use their mobility and cunning to carry out murders and robberies, only leaving chaos and destruction in their wake. Many fiendish acrobats act alone, but some might end up joining cults that serve the will of the Prince of Demons.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The deep lurker can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Grasping Tendrils
entries: The deep lurker can have up to six tendrils at a time. Each tendril can be attacked (AC 16; 10 hit points; immunity to poison and psychic damage). Destroying a tendril deals no damage to the deep lurker, which can extrude a replacement tendril on its next turn. A tendril can also be broken if a creature takes an action and succeeds on a {@dc 13} Strength check against it.

trait.name: Nimble Escape
entries: The deep lurker can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The deep lurker can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The deep lurker makes two attacks with its tendrils and uses Reel.

action.name: Tendril
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 40 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}). Until the grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the deep lurker can't use the same tendril on another target.

action.name: Reel
entries: The deep lurker pulls each creature {@condition grappled} by it up to 20 feet straight toward it.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Maelstrom {@recharge 5}
entries: The deep lurker can only use this action underwater. The deep lurker exudes a blast of pressure from its body that ripples through the surrounding water. Each creature and object within 30 feet of the deep lurker must make a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) bludgeoning damage and is pushed up to 30 feet away from the deep lurker. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage and is pushed up to 15 feet away from the deep lurker.

An aquatic analogue to the {@creature roper}, deep lurkers are spawned by the chaotic churnings of The Leviathan's dreams. Unlike the roper, a deep lurker uses its superior speed in the water to sneak in, grapple a single unsuspecting target, and swim away with its captured prey. When threatened by multiple creatures at once, a deep lurker unleashes a potent blast of pressure that pushes away any creature in nearby waters.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The brood spawn's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Ice Walk
entries: The brood spawn can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost it extra moment.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The brood spawn has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Light Sickness
entries: The brood spawn is considered to be undead for the purpose of spells and other effects that harm undead. If the brood spawn takes radiant damage or is exposed to sunlight or a magical source of light, it is {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn or until it is no longer exposed to the light.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the brood spawn fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The brood spawn has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Unyielding Essence
entries: The brood spawn is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form, as well as those that would read its thoughts, determine if it is lying, or magically influence its thoughts or behavior.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The brood spawn can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d10 + 7}) piercing damage plus 5 ({@damage 1d10}) cold damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) slashing damage plus 5 ({@damage 1d10}) cold damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the brood spawn's choice that is within 120 feet of the brood spawn and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the brood spawn's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Cold Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The brood spawn exhales an icy blast in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 21} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 54 ({@damage 12d8}) cold damage and contracts {@disease Brood Fever|EdE}. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and does not contract {@disease Brood Fever|EdE}.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The brood spawn makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: The brood spawn makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The brood spawn beats its wings. Each creature within 10 feet of the brood spawn must succeed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw or take 14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. The brood spawn can then fly up to half its flying speed.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The brood spawn's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Ice Walk
entries: The brood spawn can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost it extra moment.

trait.name: Light Sickness
entries: The brood spawn is considered to be undead for the purpose of spells and other effects that harm undead. If the brood spawn takes radiant damage or is exposed to sunlight or a magical source of light, it is {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn or until it is no longer exposed to the light.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The brood spawn has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Unyielding Essence
entries: The brood spawn is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form, as well as those that would read its thoughts, determine if it is lying, or magically influence its thoughts or behavior.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The brood spawn makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claw.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d10 + 7}) piercing damage plus 5 ({@damage 1d10}) cold damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) slashing damage plus 5 ({@damage 1d10}) cold damage.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 12} to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}29 ({@damage 4d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Cold Breath {@recharge}
entries: The brood spawn exhales an icy blast in a 40-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature contracts {@disease Brood Fever|EdE} and takes 38 ({@damage 11d6}) cold damage. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and does not contract {@disease Brood Fever|EdE}.

trait.name: Ice Walk
entries: The brood spawn can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost it extra moment.

trait.name: Light Sickness
entries: The brood spawn is considered to be undead for the purpose of spells and other effects that harm undead. If the brood spawn takes radiant damage or is exposed to sunlight or a magical source of light, it is {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn or until it is no longer exposed to the light.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The brood spawn has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Unyielding Essence
entries: The brood spawn is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form, as well as those that would read its thoughts, determine if it is lying, or magically influence its thoughts or behavior.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The brood spawn makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claw.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) cold damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) cold damage.

action.name: Cold Breath {@recharge}
entries: The brood spawn exhales an icy blast in a 20-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature contracts {@disease Brood Fever|EdE} and takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) cold damage. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and does not contract {@disease Brood Fever|EdE}.

trait.name: Ice Walk
entries: The brood spawn can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost it extra moment.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The brood spawn has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Light Sickness
entries: The brood spawn is considered to be undead for the purpose of spells and other effects that harm undead. If the brood spawn takes radiant damage or is exposed to sunlight or a magical source of light, it is {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn or until it is no longer exposed to the light.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The brood spawn has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Unyielding Essence
entries: The brood spawn is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form, as well as those that would read its thoughts, determine if it is lying, or magically influence its thoughts or behavior.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The brood spawn makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claw.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) cold damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) cold damage.

action.name: Cold Breath {@recharge}
entries: The brood spawn exhales an icy blast in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature contracts {@disease Brood Fever|EdE} and takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) cold damage. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and does not contract {@disease Brood Fever|EdE}.

trait.name: Ice Walk
entries: The brood spawn can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost it extra moment.

trait.name: Light Sickness
entries: The brood spawn is considered to be undead for the purpose of spells and other effects that harm undead. If the brood spawn takes radiant damage or is exposed to sunlight or a magical source of light, it is {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn or until it is no longer exposed to the light.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The brood spawn has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Unyielding Essence
entries: The brood spawn is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form, as well as those that would read its thoughts, determine if it is lying, or magically influence its thoughts or behavior.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The brood spawn makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claw.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) cold damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) cold damage.

action.name: Cold Breath {@recharge}
entries: The brood spawn exhales an icy blast in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature contracts {@disease Brood Fever|EdE} and takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) cold damage. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and does not contract {@disease Brood Fever|EdE}.

monster.name: Father Llymic

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Father Llymic's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 22}). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Anathematic Secrecy
entries: Father Llymic can't be targeted by any divination magic or perceived through magical scrying sensors.

trait.name: Deadly Chill
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of Father Llymic must make a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) cold damage and suffering one level of {@condition soul chill|EdE} on a failed save.

trait.name: Fever Dream
entries: Any creature that takes a short or long rest within 300 feet of Father Llymic's frozen form must make a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature contracts {@disease Brood Fever|EdE}.

trait.name: Ice Walk
entries: Father Llymic can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost him extra moment.

trait.name: Improved Critical
entries: Father Llymic's weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20 on the {@dice d20}.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Father Llymic fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Light Torpor
entries: Father Llymic is considered to be undead for the purpose of spells and other effects that harm undead. If Father Llymic takes radiant damage or is exposed to natural sunlight or a magical source of light, he is {@condition poisoned} until the end of his next turn or until he is no longer exposed to the light. If Father Llymic is exposed to natural sunlight, he must succeed on a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw at the start of his next turn or slip into suspended animation (as the {@spell feign death} spell). This condition can only be removed by keeping Father Llymic in complete darkness for at least one round.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Father Llymic has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Father Llymic's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: Father Llymic regains 20 hit points at the start of his turn if he is in complete darkness and has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Soul Chill
entries: When Father Llymic deals damage to a creature with his claw or bite, the creature suffers one level of {@condition soul chill|EdE}.

trait.name: Unyielding Essence
entries: Father Llymic is immune to any spell or effect that would alter his form, as well as those that would read his thoughts, determine if he is lying, or magically influence his thoughts or behavior.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Father Llymic uses his Summon Brood if it is available. He then makes three attacks: one with his bite and two with his claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d10 + 8}) piercing damage plus 5 ({@damage 1d10}) cold damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d6 + 8}) slashing damage plus 5 ({@damage 1d10}) cold damage.

action.name: Brood Seed
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}Father Llymic implants a target with a brood seed. When initially hit, and at the start of each of its turns, the target must make a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target gains {@dice 1d4} levels of {@condition soul chill|EdE}. If the target succeeds on three of these saves, the effect ends for it. The brood seed can only be removed by a {@spell greater restoration} spell cast while the target is in the area of a {@spell daylight} spell or similar effect, or in natural sunshine.

action.name: Discord and Woe (2/Day)
entries: One creature within 100 miles of Father Llymic that Father Llymic is aware of must make a {@dc 22} Wisdom saving throw. A creature automatically succeeds if it is immune to being {@condition charmed}. On a failed save, the target must target its allies with attacks and other damaging effects for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to Father Llymic's Discord and Woe for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Summon Brood {@recharge}
entries: Father Llymic magically summons two {@creature brood spawn barbarian|EdE|brood spawn barbarians} in unoccupied spaces within 30 feet of him. These brood spawns act on their own initiative count and follow Father Llymic's orders to the best of their ability.

legendaryHeader: Father Llymic can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Father Llymic regains spent legendary actions at the start of his turn.

legendary.name: Move
entries: Father Llymic moves up to his speed.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Father Llymic casts one of his innate spells.

legendary.name: Savage (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Father Llymic makes a claw attack against each creature within 15 feet of him.

In his true and unnatural form, Father Llymic looks like a cross between a gigantic crystalline praying mantis and a horrible demon, with two scythe-like claws in place of arms. His head bears a trio of compound eyes above a gaping maw of fangs. The rest of his translucent body is covered in shards of crystal that form a deadly armor plating. When he moves, these plates grind and shatter against one another, with new ones endlessly taking their place. A cloud of freezing cold mist surrounds him, obscuring his alien bulk.

While he is imprisoned, Father Llymic appears as a strangely colored stain deep beneath the surface of a great glacial flow. If he were to be dug out, it would take only a few days of darkness to revive him. Without such effort, it might take centuries for him to find the strength to break free, and then only through the conversion of countless brood. Even dormant, however, Father Llymic has ways of influencing the world around him. His tendrils worm through the surface of the ice, so that any who stand directly above him are affected by his corruption. In addition, he can project an image—a shard of his dreaming mind—into the world around him.

Father Llymic projects the illusory image of a wizened elf man, bent with age. Calm and inoffensive in appearance, the image's clothes are ragged and worn. He walks with a staff and never makes any noise. This projection can be seen near Father Llymic's tomb, beckoning explorers closer. Although the projection is slow of gait and never aggressive, it can never be caught. Whenever anyone draws too close, it steps out of sight, reappearing some distance away. If its targets refuse to follow it, the image grows agitated, appearing before them and silently screaming from a maw of razor-sharp ice fangs, then leaving to find other prey.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The aboleth can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Corrupt Positive Energy Aura
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the aboleth takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) radiant damage. An undead creature instead takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) damage and suffers disadvantage on all saving throws until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Freedom of Movement
entries: The aboleth ignores difficult terrain, and magical effects can't reduce its speed or cause it to be {@condition restrained}. It can spend 5 feet of movement to escape from nonmagical restraints or being {@condition grappled}.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The aboleth has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Mucous Cloud
entries: While underwater, the aboleth is surrounded by transformative mucus. A creature that touches the aboleth or that hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is diseased for {@dice 1d4} hours. The diseased creature can breathe only underwater.

trait.name: Positive Energy Corruption
entries: When the aboleth deals damage to a creature, the creature must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or suffer one level of {@condition positive energy corruption|EdE}.

trait.name: Probing Telepathy
entries: If a creature communicates telepathically with the aboleth, the aboleth learns the creature's greatest desires if the aboleth can see the creature.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The aboleth regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point. If the aboleth takes necrotic damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the aboleth's next turn.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The aboleth can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Warped Flesh
entries: The aboleth is immune to poison and disease, and any creature that touches the aboleth or hits it with a melee attack must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or take 11 ({@damage 2d10}) poison damage. Additionally, any critical hit against the aboleth becomes a normal hit.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The aboleth makes three melee attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) radiant damage.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) radiant damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or become diseased. The disease has no effect for 1 minute and can be removed by any magic that cures disease. After 1 minute, the diseased creature's skin becomes translucent and slimy, the creature can't regain hit points unless it is underwater, and the disease can be removed only by heal or another disease-curing spell of 6th level or higher. When the creature is outside a body of water, it takes 6 ({@damage 1d12}) acid damage every 10 minutes unless moisture is applied to the skin before 10 minutes have passed.

action.name: Enslave (3/Day)
entries: The aboleth targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or be magically {@condition charmed} by the aboleth until the aboleth dies or until it is on a different plane of existence from the target. The {@condition charmed} target is under the aboleth's control and can't take reactions, and the aboleth and the target can communicate telepathically with each other over any distance.

Whenever the {@condition charmed} target takes damage, the target can repeat the saving throw. On a success, the effect ends. No more than once every 24 hours, the target can also repeat the saving throw when it is at least 1 mile away from the aboleth.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The aboleth moves up to its speed.

legendary.name: Regenerate Worldskin
entries: The aboleth regenerates a {@filter worldskin feature|trapshazards|source=EdE} within 100 feet of it.

legendary.name: Grab (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The aboleth attempts to grapple each creature within 10 feet of it. As the aboleth's "legs" are made up of numerous humanoid bodies, it can have up to 5 creatures {@condition grappled} at a time.

legendary.name: Skincasting (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The aboleth activates a {@filter worldskin feature|trapshazards|source=EdE} within 100 feet of it.

legendary.name: Reaping Legs (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The aboleth makes a separate slam attack against each creature within 10 feet of it.

An aboleth sarcoma is an {@creature aboleth} that has been corrupted by Ragnorra's influence. Bloated and discolored, this aboleth has fused with the bodies of various humanoids and uses them as though they were spider legs. Combining the psionic power and disease-spreading body of an aboleth with the twisted flesh and positive energy corruption of Ragnorra, this terrifying creature is a perfect example of what Ragnorra believes to be an ideal form of life.

trait.name: Corrupt Positive Energy Aura
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the blistered soul takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) radiant damage. An undead creature instead takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) damage and suffers disadvantage on all saving throws until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The blistered soul has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Positive Energy Corruption
entries: When the blistered soul deals damage to a creature, the creature must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or suffer one level of {@condition positive energy corruption|EdE}.

trait.name: Revert to Spore
entries: As a last-ditch defense, the blistered soul can use its bonus action to rejoin the worldskin by forming a {@hazard spawning spore|EdE}. The new spore appears in the blistered soul's former position. It is considered expended and must be fully regenerated before it can be activated. Casting {@spell dispel magic} on the spore within 3 rounds of transformation destroys it and returns the blistered soul to the surface. The blistered soul retains any damage and ongoing conditions from before it attempted to revert.

trait.name: Unyielding Essence
entries: The blistered soul is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form, as well as those that would read its thoughts, determine if it is lying, or magically influence its thoughts or behavior.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The blistered soul makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) radiant damage.

action.name: Tumor
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 40/80 ft., one creature. {@h}12 ({@damage 5d4}) poison damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) radiant damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. The poisoned target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

action.name: Regenerate Worldskin
entries: The blistered soul regenerates a {@filter worldskin feature|trapshazards|source=EdE} within 100 feet of it.

action.name: Skincasting
entries: The blistered soul activates a {@filter worldskin feature|trapshazards|source=EdE} within 100 feet of it.

Blistered souls are horrible creations of Ragnorra's corrupt positive energy, at its most intense so close to her resting place. They resemble skinless humanoids with four arms and oversized, grasping claws. Their "bones" are actually glowing columns of positive energy, which animates their flesh and gives them life. The extreme energies cause tumors to erupt continually on their bodies. As a result, blistered souls are in constant pain.

trait.name: Death Burst
entries: When the malshaper brute dies, it explodes in a burst of positive energy. Each creature within 15 feet of the malshaper brute takes 22 ({@damage 4d10}) radiant damage.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The malshaper is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Positive Energy Corruption
entries: When the malshaper deals radiant damage to a creature, the creature must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or suffer one level of {@condition positive energy corruption|EdE}.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The malshaper regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point. If the malshaper takes necrotic damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the malshaper's next turn.

trait.name: Warped Flesh
entries: The malshaper is immune to poison and disease, and any creature that touches the malshaper or hits it with a melee attack must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or take 11 ({@damage 2d10}) poison damage. Additionally, any critical hit against the malshaper becomes a normal hit.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The malshaper makes two melee attacks, and uses Sculpt Flesh if it is available.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d12 + 5}) slashing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) radiant damage.

action.name: Sculpt Flesh {@recharge 5}
entries: The malshaper touches one creature within 10 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or have its flesh warped by unnatural growth, covering it in blisters and tumors. While its flesh is warped in this way, the target is {@condition poisoned}, its speed is reduced by 10 feet, and it can't use reactions. This effect lasts for 1 minute. The {@condition poisoned} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

reaction.name: Shrug it Off
entries: The malshaper halves the damage that it takes from an attack that hits it. The malshaper must be able to see the attacker. The malshaper must be able to see the attacker.

Transformed by corrupt positive energy during a {@cult Ragnorra the Mother of Monsters|EdE|Malshaper} ritual, a malshaper brute is a Large hybrid between an aberration and a humanoid. They still retain their race and identity, but their flesh has been sculpted with the intent of making them the ultimate warrior. Similar in size and stature to a {@creature star spawn hulk|mtf}, malshaper brutes are used against any creatures or organizations that would seek to oppose Ragnorra's corruption.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The malshaper's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom. It can innately cast the following spells (spell save {@dc 18}), requiring no material components:
footerEntries: *No concentration is required to maintain these spells, and the malshaper casts them on itself and/or its allies before combat.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The malshaper is a 15th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following spells prepared:

trait.name: Dark Devotion
entries: The malshaper has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The malshaper regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point. If the malshaper takes necrotic damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Warped Flesh
entries: The malshaper is immune to poison and disease, and any creature that touches the malshaper or hits it with a melee attack must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or take 16 ({@damage 3d10}) poison damage. Additionally, any critical hit against the malshaper becomes a normal hit.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The malshaper casts a spell, and then uses Sculpt Flesh if it is available.

action.name: Sculpt Flesh {@recharge 4}
entries: The malshaper touches one creature within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or have its flesh warped by unnatural growth, covering it in blisters and tumors. While its flesh is warped in this way, the target is {@condition poisoned}, its speed is reduced by 10 feet, and it can't use reactions. This effect lasts for 1 minute. The {@condition poisoned} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Malshaper planeswalkers are among the upper echelon of the {@cult Ragnorra the Mother of Monsters|EdE|Malshaper} cult. Having mastered the arts of both learned and innate spellcasting, these cultists are capable of bringing themselves and their underlings across the planes in their quest to guide Ragnorra from world to world.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The malshaper's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom. It can innately cast the following spells (spell save {@dc 14}), requiring no material components:
footerEntries: *No concentration is required to maintain these spells, and the malshaper casts them on itself and/or its allies before combat.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The malshaper is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following spells prepared:

trait.name: Dark Devotion
entries: The malshaper has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Warped Flesh
entries: The malshaper is immune to poison and disease. Additionally, any critical hit against the malshaper becomes a normal hit.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The malshaper cast a spell, and then uses Sculpt Flesh if it is available.

action.name: Sculpt Flesh {@recharge}
entries: The malshaper touches one creature within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or have its flesh warped by unnatural growth, covering it in blisters and tumors. While its flesh is warped in this way, the target is {@condition poisoned}, its speed is reduced by 10 feet, and it can't use reactions. This effect lasts for 1 minute. The {@condition poisoned} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Dagger
